items.name: Scissors
items.description: A basic pair of scissors. Snip snip.

items.name: FountainPen
items.description: A kind of pen for writing. The ink inside the pen holder flows out through the nib, allowing it to be used for a long time - though your hand will be covered in ink if not used correctly. Or if you are a lefty.

items.name: KitchenKnife
items.description: A knife used in the kitchen. It can be a deadly weapon in the hands of an expert.

items.name: ArmyKnife
items.description: Very threatening yet easy to carry. It faithfully performs its duties, such as cutting and stabbing.

items.name: Vibroblade
items.description: This high-frequency vibrating blade will cleave the matter of its target at a molecular level. The knife vibrates at a frequency beyond human imagination.

items.name: RustySword
items.description: Every swordsman must train with this common longsword.

items.name: Shamshir
items.description: The name translates into "The Tail of the Lion." A symbolic sword of Persia, it's also known to be the origin of the sabre.

items.name: Katana
items.description: I can't believe that I'm actually holding a Japanese sword that I saw in the movies!

items.name: Masamune
items.description: A sword made by Masamune, the greatest sword maker in the history of Japan. It stands as one of the strongest and sharpest swords of Japan.

items.name: Muramasa
items.description: A sword cursing the Tokugawa family, who were the founders of Japan's Tokugawa shogunate. Tokugawa Leyasu's grandfather, father, and son were all killed or wounded by this sword, and Leyasu himself also had his finger cut off.

items.name: BastardSword
items.description: In the Middle Ages, the Bastard Sword was the only weapon with the characteristics of both a double-handed sword and a single-handed sword, so it was named Bastard, meaning mixed breed.

items.name: JewelSword
items.description: Valuable by its very existence. Often is the case of such swords that were made with precious materials or used by a famous hero.

items.name: Arondight
items.description: The sword of Sir Lancelot, who was a dragon slayer that cut down the fire drake during the rescue of princess Elaine of Corbenic.

items.name: Excalibur
items.description: A noted sword produced in Avalon, the nation of fairies. King  Arthur received this sword from the beautiful Lady of the Lake and returned it after the final battle against Prince Mordred.

items.name: PlasmaSword
items.description: A sword made from the combination of ion nuclei and free electrons kept at an ultra-high temperature, also known as plasma. Due to its explosive nature, it's hard to handle, but it could be the start of an era of future weaponry. The plasma sword is the first of its kind.

items.name: Laevateinn
items.description: In Norse mythology, Laevateinn is a sword that was made by Loki by carving runes into it. In mythology, it is used to kill the invincible rooster, Vidofnir.

items.name: Monohoshizao
items.description: A sword with a long blade. Legend says Kojiro Sasaki cut a flying swallow with this sword. A technique known as "Upward Cutting" is commonly used after an opponent dodges the first attack.

items.name: Hovud
items.description: It is said that this blade, as mentioned briefly in "Prose Edda", was used by the Nordic mythical god Heimdallr and was made out of broken pieces of the rainbow bridge, Bifröst. The entire blade emits a dark blue aura, which makes the sword difficult to approach. Some people believe this blade's name means "head".

items.name: TwinSwords
items.description: Double the sword, double the offense!

items.name: Florentine
items.description: The master of these swords from Florence says you can't use them seperately. One in each hand at all times.

items.name: DivineDualSwords
items.description: A swordsmanship technique created and refined by Miyamoto Musashi. It involves using two swords, a shortsword in one hand and a longsword in the other.

items.name: StarsteelTwinSwords
items.description: A pair of swords that Liu Bei used in "Romance of the Three Kingdoms".

items.name: Dioscuri
items.description: Named after the Greek mythological twin brothers, Castor and Pollux. Twins but with different dads!

items.name: LloigorZahr
items.description: You'll love crafting these twin swords, just be careful if you feel wind but the weather isn't windy. Lloigor might be watching.

items.name: Hammer
items.description: Try not to hammer your finger instead of the nail...

items.name: Warhammer
items.description: It's like a gift set of close combat weapons! Includes a hammer for striking, a spear for piercing, and a sword for slashing.

items.name: MorningStar
items.description: A blunt weapon you use with both hands. It was used by infantry against knights on horseback. The head of the weapon can be changed according to the user's style.

items.name: HammerOfThor
items.description: The hammer that Thor, the God of Thunder, used. Also called Mjolnir, meaning "The Destroyer."

items.name: MagicStick
items.description: The stick often carried by the main characters of Shoujo comics. The moral of the Shoujo genre is that peace must be maintained through greater power.

items.name: Pickaxe
items.description: Can we consider it a blade attack if you swing the pickaxe and attack your opponent..?

items.name: Hatchet
items.description: It looks heavy, so attack with it by slicing downward.

items.name: ChainScythe
items.description: A weapon of the Grim Reaper that has a sharp scythe at one end of a steel chain.

items.name: BattleAxe
items.description: Although it started as a tool for men, it proved itself useful in the battlefield. It's designed to rip flesh and cut bones, so it has a thinner and lighter blade than a usual ax.

items.name: ReapersScythe
items.description: A weapon that the Grim Reaper carries. If the scythe claims someone, that soul will vanish.

items.name: BeamAxe
items.description: Widely used since the Old Stone Age, it became a masterpiece when fused with modern technology.

items.name: SantaMuerte
items.description: Santa Muerte, the Mexican goddess of death, cuts off all negative energies with her long-handled scythe.

items.name: Harpe
items.description: The sword given to Perseus by Hermes, the God of Thieves. He used this to cut off Medusa's head and to rescue Andromeda from a sea monster.

items.name: ShortSpear
items.description: A spear with a short shaft - about half the size of a long spear. Learn how to move freely during battle while wielding this weapon and attack with a fearless combat posture.

items.name: BambooSpear
items.description: A spear made out of bamboo. Yup.

items.name: Bident
items.description: The weapon of Hades, the Greek god of the underworld.  It's a two-pronged spear and one of the known treasures of Hades, along with his cornucopia and helmet.

items.name: HalberdAxe
items.description: On one end there's an ax blade and on the other end there's a stabbing blade.

items.name: CosmicBident
items.description: A futuristic version of the spear of Hades, the Greek god of the underworld.  Snuff out the future of your enemy with this futuristic technology.

items.name: LanceOfPoseidon
items.description: A powerful spear that can bring forth waves. It's said to have once been used by Poseidon.

items.name: BlazingLance
items.description: The length stretches freely, and flames spurt from the end of the spear; a treasure that appeared in "Fengshen Yanyi."

items.name: DragonGuandao
items.description: Made of 49 kg of iron during the Three Kingdoms period. It was thought to be used by Guan Yu.

items.name: SpearOfLonginus
items.description: Though its origins may be unclear, this spear is said to have been involved in mythical holiness. Texts say that this spear has the ability to heal its owner under certain conditions.

items.name: Branch
items.description: Now's not the time to protect the environment. Now is the time to protect yourself.

items.name: ShortRod
items.description: Fine to carry and suitable for offense.

items.name: LongRod
items.description: You can keep more distance than when using a short rod, but you still have to be careful.

items.name: GoblinBat
items.description: A supernatural demon from the East that is said to be playful with humans. Westerns may identify them as an "Imp."

items.name: Umbrella
items.description: You might wonder how this became a weapon, but it is often used as a murder weapon in mystery stories.

items.name: Torch
items.description: The torch that lights your way might help you keep your own life from being extinguished. If you see an enemy, don't hesitate to swing.

items.name: StatueOfSoteria
items.description: Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free, the wretched refuse of your teeming shore. Send these, the homeless, tempest-tossed to me. I lift my lamp beside the golden door.

items.name: SpyUmbrella
items.description: There is a poisoned needle concealed at the tip of the umbrella. You can make use of it when the timing is right. Pretend to accidentally stab your target's foot with the tip while carrying it on a rainy day.

items.name: MonkeyKingBar
items.description: A tool, made by Daode Tianzun, used for measuring the depth of the river and sea. The Dragon King of the East Sea kept it in his palace storage, but Sun Wukong stole it and used it as a weapon.

items.name: BrassKnuckles
items.description: These are actually illegal in a lot of countries.

items.name: IronKnuckles
items.description: Though it may look like ordinary knuckles, but it's made with a much sturdier iron, so it hits much harder.

items.name: Gauntlet
items.description: Gloves that knights wore to protect their hands.

items.name: WingKnuckles
items.description: Free your burdened soul with these masterfully created wings. But there exists no sky for you to spread your wings...

items.name: BoneGauntlet
items.description: Armored gloves made from a turtle shell.

items.name: ShatterShellGauntlet
items.description: A glove that adds explosive force behind each punch.

items.name: GlassKnuckles
items.description: Knuckles coated with glass fragments. They're not entirely made of glass!

items.name: PhoenixGloves
items.description: You cannot reach the point of Nirvana to separate your body and soul, but you can remove others' souls from their bodies with this glove.

items.name: BloodwingKnuckles
items.description: Knuckles that seemingly fit the Dark Angel. How can you return when your wings are covered in crimson blood..?

items.name: FrostPetalHand
items.description: A guardian spirit that was passed down through generations of the North Polar Sea kingdom's bloodline. Petal-shaped ice flakes form along its surface to protect its user from harm.

items.name: BrasilGauntlet
items.description: A combat glove used on the mystical island Brasil, which is located  west side of Ireland. This island can only be seen once every seven years. (Not to be confused with the country Brazil)

items.name: Bamboo
items.description: It doesn't thicken as it grows, and dies after blooming. We make baskets out of it because of its flexibility.

items.name: Tonfa
items.description: A weapon that is modified and widely used in Okinawa. Tonfa-based martial arts shares many similarities with bare-handed martial arts.

items.name: PlasmaTonfa
items.description: A tonfa-shaped weapon made out of plasma. It uses a chip that registers its owner's information, so it won't harm its owner and will be safe to use.

items.name: Grenade
items.description: Be careful! The moment you relax and forget you're carrying a grenade is the moment that you become a victim. Boom.

items.name: MolotovCocktail
items.description: Make a mistake and drop it, you'll become your own worst enemy.

items.name: FlourBomb
items.description: By combining a flour bomb and some gunpowder, you can make a smoke bomb. Let's see if there's any gunpowder around here...

items.name: IncendiaryBomb
items.description: Inflict damage by quickly spreading fire to an area. It'll be hard to extinguish.

items.name: BallLightning
items.description: You can knock out your enemies by throwing the hammer, but it's your choice to run or keep fighting.

items.name: Flubber
items.description: It feels like the innocence of childhood. If you drop it, it'll lose its viscosity and become stiff, so take care of it.

items.name: DavidsSling
items.description: David's legendary stone that killed Goliath, the giant of Philistine.

items.name: SmokeBomb
items.description: Inflicts immense damage by emitting a poisonous gas. It is made from gunpowder and a special barrel.

items.name: SpikyBouncyBall
items.description: A rubber ball with sharp fragments on the surface. It hurts. Also, don't underestimate its bouncing capability!

items.name: HighExplosiveGrenade
items.description: It hurts when you touch it, but it even hurts more when it explodes next to you.

items.name: RutheniumMarble
items.description: Made out of Ruthenium, which is the hardest element among the platinum metals. It also has applications as a superconductor.

items.name: Razor
items.description: Check for these in your Halloween candy before you eat it!

items.name: PlayingCards
items.description: It's exhilarating to have a lucky win streak.

items.name: Dart
items.description: It's cute, but it can be deadly if it hits the right spot.

items.name: VintageCards
items.description: A shabby looking deck of cards. Probably used to gamble in a sketchy alley.

items.name: ThrowingStars
items.description: It's convenient, but be careful when using it. It doesn't come back to you like a boomerang.

items.name: OnyxDagger
items.description: Made out of a throwing dagger and a cross. It practically jumps from the tips of your fingers to fly into the heart of your enemy

items.name: Chakram
items.description: The chakram is basically a throwing weapon, but in some cases, it also can be used to slash enemies like a melee weapon. Its circular shape has sharp blades around it, making it even more deadly.

items.name: ApricotFlowerTag
items.description: A brazen claim by some say they used to be fighters, but nobody has ever actually seen them fight.

items.name: CardsOfTyranny
items.description: A brazen claim by some say they used to be fighters, but nobody has ever actually seen them fight.

items.name: VenomDart
items.description: This deadly poison can kill an elephant within 3 seconds. Use it carefully.

items.name: DharmaChakram
items.description: A legendary weapon Buddha used to exorcise a demon. It causes damage with the sharp blades that rotate around its perimeter.

items.name: FuhmaShuriken
items.description: A ninja star originally used by Humma, a band of ninja that were active during the Sengoku period.

items.name: AzureDagger
items.description: Blue weapons aren't always associated with ice or water...

items.name: Sudarsana
items.description: A weapon of Vishnu, one of the three main Hindu Gods. It was used to destroy air fortresses.

items.name: Bow
items.description: Try not to cry if the bowstring hits your face.

items.name: WoodenBow
items.description: A wooden bow. As plain as it seems, you need choice timber to make a usable wooden bow. Plywood is a no go.

items.name: Longbow
items.description: A unique Korean bow incorporating a horn in its designs. Anyone can use the bow, as it will adapt to the user.

items.name: CompositeBow
items.description: A high quality composite bow that was used in the East. There is a record of a man shooting over 440 meters during the England Archery Competition of 1795.

items.name: StrongBow
items.description: A bow with strong elasticity, the bow string is made of 240 strands of three-ply thread.

items.name: StallionBow
items.description: A traditional Korean bow that can kill a tiger with a single arrow.

items.name: MightyBow
items.description: A bow that can be made by combining a bow and gunpowder. While hiding in darkness, you must draw the bow quietly, but quickly.

items.name: PelletBow
items.description: Can fire bullets instead of arrows. It'd be a good idea to check to see if there are more bullets around.

items.name: Scorchbow
items.description: A fiery arrow will burn your enemy.

items.name: GoldenRatioBow
items.description: A composite bow and arrow designed according to the golden ratio. It boasts extraordinary precision.

items.name: Twinbow
items.description: A bow modified to fire arrows with more power by crossing the bowstrings.

items.name: ElementalBow
items.description: A bow with the elemental powers of nature, such as fire or electricity. Similar to the four elements of Aristotle.

items.name: Failnaught
items.description: The arrows of Tristan, one of the Knights of the Round Table. Known as the arrows that never miss, so it will fail you not.

items.name: Crossbow
items.description: A mechanical bow that requires little human strength, but reloading takes a little longer than an ordinary bow.

items.name: LongCrossbow
items.description: A long range weapon that can shoot further than a standard bow. During the Chosun Period, there are records of shots landing from as far as 600 steps away.

items.name: ShortCrossbow
items.description: This is a mechanical bow, so take aim and shoot at will.

items.name: PowerCrossbow
items.description: A good weapon, but it's paramount that you keep good track of your arrows.

items.name: LaserCrossbow
items.description: A bow specialized for sniping. As always, aim is important.

items.name: HeavyCrossbow
items.description: Heavier than a standard crossbow, but also that much stronger. It was a popular weapon in Medieval Europe as it was easy to learn and use.

items.name: SteelBow
items.description: A bow made out of steel. It might be heavy to some.

items.name: Ballista
items.description: A smaller bow originally designed for siege warfare. It boasts incredible power.

items.name: SniperCrossbow
items.description: A new type of bow with remarkably high accuracy. It's equipped with a laser sight, similar to modern sniper rifles.

items.name: MagnumPython
items.description: If you research revolvers that use Magnum cartridges, you'll find that some of them use scientific names for snakes. This one is the  Pythonidae, also known as Python.

items.name: DoubleRevolverSP
items.description: This isn't two revolvers -- it's one double revolver.

items.name: MagnumAnaconda
items.description: Named after the Anaconda, which is larger than a Python, it uses a larger caliber Magnum cartridge.

items.name: DevilsMarksman
items.description: You can perfect your marksmanship by selling your soul to the devil. What could possibly go wrong?

items.name: Elegance
items.description: Though it looks like an old gun, it is actually a smaller version of the railgun pistol. Up to 6 bullets are loaded from a clip. At first glance, it looks like a decoration, but it is just as effective as the real, full-size version.

items.name: ElectronBlaster
items.description: It's not as strong as the laser guns used on the other side of the cosmos, but it's still pretty powerful.

items.name: Kelte
items.description: The gun of Manas, a hero of Kyrgyzstan. The gun’s barrel was formed from Damascus steel and fires death in bullet form.

items.name: MachineGun
items.description: A gun that continuously fires bullets when the trigger is held down.

items.name: GatlingGun
items.description: The world's first machine gun, it fires through several barrels joined together. Can cause catastrophic damage to the enemy in a short period of time.

items.name: LongRifle
items.description: An old type of gun that isn't frequently used these days. Requires lighting a fuse to shoot.

items.name: HarpoonGun
items.description: A powerful gun that fires harpoons. Thar she blows!

items.name: GoldenRifle
items.description: A rifle accented with gold. High in both accuracy, destructive power, and flashiness.

items.name: Railgun
items.description: Uses electromagnets to rapidly accelerate and launch a metal projectile.

items.name: Polaris
items.description: When a person dies, their soul will heads to the afterlife world. However, dying from this weapon appears to banish their soul even further. Perhaps to the North Star?

items.name: Needle
items.description: An item with multiple uses; limited only by your imagination.

items.name: Rapier
items.description: A one-handed sword for personal combat with a long, thin blade ideal for stabbing. Used mostly in the 16th and 17th centuries.

items.name: SwordOfJustice
items.description: Historical texts state that Hong Gil-dong, the Robin Hood of ancient Korea, used it.

items.name: Volticletto
items.description: The word "Volticletto" is a portmanteau of 'voltaic,' meaning related to electric current, and the Italian 'Stiletto knife'. Punctures from this weapon cause double the pain.

items.name: MeteorClaymore
items.description: The silver-grey colored metals found in Meteorsteel can be used to make a great sword with great strength. However, manufacturing it is no easy task.

items.name: GoldenBridge
items.description: Some people think that the more expensive it is, the better it sounds.

items.name: SingleCoilPickup
items.description: Single coil guitars generally have a brighter, crisper output, and sound clearer.

items.name: RubySpecial
items.description: A unique guitar that is as red as a ruby.

items.name: HumbuckerPickup
items.description: A guitar with dual coil pickups. It has a darker output.

items.name: KingV
items.description: This guitar has an unconventional V shape. Although it was sensational at release, it didn't see huge popularity.

items.name: Nocaster
items.description: The most used title in art is "Untitled". Isn't there an unsaid rule that says not to do that with guitar names?

items.name: Superstrat
items.description: Collectively refers to the most famous types of guitars in the world.

items.name: WildHorse
items.description: If it follows in the footsteps of the performance it takes its name from, you can probably expect to be in front of a large audience with this one.

items.name: Bohemian
items.description: "Bohemian" was first used to describe a part of the Czech population, but it is now used to represent free spirits.

items.name: StairwayToHeaven
items.description: Heaven might be all bright and shiny, but we can't say the same for the stairway leading up to it. It might be covered in lead...

items.name: PurpleHaze
items.description: Whether tomorrow is waiting for you, or if it's really the end of time... this island doesn't have the answer.

items.name: Satisfaction
items.description: The human nature of not being satisfied is what drives development. Humanity always blindly trusts evolution.

items.name: WonderfulTonight
items.description: If it's late in the evening, and you're wondering what item to craft, try this one!

items.name: TheWall
items.description: The test subjects on this island might as well just be, all in all, bricks in a wall.

items.name: TeenSpirit
items.description: Humans shine the most as teens. This shining aura fades slowly, but inevitably, as times passes by.

items.name: Hairband
items.description: If you use a cheap one, the glue might stick to your hair or ears.

items.name: Hat
items.description: Nothing beats than a simple cap when it's sunny, raining, or snowing.

items.name: BikeHelmet
items.description: A shabby and cheap looking helmet for when you take your bike for a spin.

items.name: Mask
items.description: If you can escape from Lumia Island, try visiting the Carnival of Venice. It's one of the most popular festivals in the world, but you can visit only if you manage to get out of here alive.

items.name: Circlet
items.description: A simple accessory worn on the head. It looks rather plain.

items.name: Beret
items.description: The trademark hat of painters and soldiers. It gets sweaty inside easily and it doesn't block the sun, but at least it looks cool.

items.name: ChainCoif
items.description: A piece of defensive equipment that was commonly used in Medieval Europe. It's quite heavy, but has good defensive capabilities.

items.name: SafetyHelmet
items.description: Please wear your personal protective equipment in all construction areas.

items.name: BallisticHelmet
items.description: Battered and tattered Ballistic Helmet. Initials marked inside the helmet scratched out and written over. Seems it's been passed around plenty of times.

items.name: FireHelmet
items.description: Head protection for firefighters. Strong resistance to flames and heat. Also equipped with a flashlight!

items.name: Tiara
items.description: A crown-like accessory for the head. Worn by both princesses and beauty pagent winners.

items.name: Crown
items.description: The one  to wear the crown must bear its weight.

items.name: CloseHelm
items.description: A helmet made out of steel to protect the head of its wearer. It's heavy, but it makes you feel safe.

items.name: MithrilHelm
items.description: A helm made of mithril that's been reforged through generations. Delicate reliefs carved into the surface hint at the craftsmanship invested into it.

items.name: CrystalTiara
items.description: A tiara made of crystals. The intricacies are impressive.

items.name: TacticalOPSHelmet
items.description: A tactical helmet used by special forces. Military grade communication technology is built-in.

items.name: HelmOfBanneret
items.description: The war has begun and the righteous knight stands at the vanguard. May the blessings of victory be upon him.

items.name: LaurelWreath
items.description: A crown made of branches of a laurel tree, which is a symbol of Apollo. Crowns symbolize wealth, but a laurel crown symbolizes honor.

items.name: ImperialCrown
items.description: A crown built for the first and only monarch of the Kingdom of Finland, Friedrich Karl. However, due to the adoption of the republican constitution before the coronation, the crown has never been used since.

items.name: ImperialBurgonet
items.description: An extravagant burgonet used by the imperial family. Unlike a basic helmet, it is lavishly decorated

items.name: Windbreaker
items.description: A jumper that keeps you warm by blocking out the wind. It works best when it blocks the wind completely, so make sure to wear it properly!

items.name: MonksRobe
items.description: Clothing for monks. The arm of each side is divided into four parts, representing Manjushri, Samantabhadra, Guanyin, and Ksitigarbha

items.name: Wetsuit
items.description: A kind of swimsuit that covers parts of the legs and arms or the whole body from neck down. Aka a wet suit!

items.name: FabricArmor
items.description: Armor made from fabric. It doesn't seem to protect you from much. Good luck.

items.name: LeatherArmor
items.description: Armor made from leather. Stronger than armor made from just fabric!

items.name: LeatherJacket
items.description: A reliable jacket that doesn't tear easily. Useful in most weather conditions.

items.name: TurtleDobok
items.description: A martial arts uniform worn by ninja turtles. They're obviously giant turtles, why do they need masks?

items.name: MilitarySuit
items.description: Like a school uniform, these military uniforms get some people excited! But when you actually see them out in the street...meh.

items.name: PatchedRobe
items.description: Made by patching together various robes. Might be more reliable than a regular robe.

items.name: Dress
items.description: Historically, not only women wore dresses as casual attire. In fact, it's only been about 600 years since men started wearing pants.

items.name: Bikini
items.description: It's a bikini made of a thin fabric. You might wanna suck in your stomach when you're wearing it. It's so versatile, men can wear it, too.

items.name: DivingSuit
items.description: A diving suit with filler between the inner and outer skin. It excels at maintaining body temperature and enduring higher pressure.

items.name: RiderJacket
items.description: Worn more often as a fashion statement than for actual riding.

items.name: ChainArmor
items.description: Armor used in both Asia and Europe in the past. Made out of interconnecting metal links.

items.name: Suit
items.description: A sharp outfit that can be worn for any special event! Or if your office has a dress code!

items.name: Qipao
items.description: A traditional Chinese dress. They vary in style from simple cotton dresses to silk ones with elaborate fine details.

items.name: SheetMetalArmor
items.description: Armor comprised of several layers of metal plates. Sheet Metal Armor is effective at withstanding slashing and striking attacks, but is weaker against long-range weapons.

items.name: Hanbok
items.description: A traditional Korean dress. The diverse range of colors and elegant embroidery enhances the harmony of curves and straight lines.

items.name: BulletproofVest
items.description: A vest used to protect your torso from bullets. The rest of the body is still vulnerable, though

items.name: SunsetArmor
items.description: Made of leather, it features a ruby that shines like a bright, red sun

items.name: CovertAgentUniform
items.description: The uniform worn by agents that performed special missions for the King. Secretly.

items.name: OpticalCamouflageSuit
items.description: In the right environment, body parts covered by the suit become invisible.

items.name: RockersJacket
items.description: There's something burning in my HEART. Today, I can do anything.

items.name: MithrilArmor
items.description: Normal chain armor cannot completely protect its wearer from external impact, but the Mithril material on this armor defies the normality of chain armor.

items.name: CrusaderArmor
items.description: Some say that this armor provides special protection from the undead. It's a shame there's no zombies around here.

items.name: AmazonessArmor
items.description: Armor bestowed upon female warriors with outstanding archery ability and agility. Allows for flexibilty and protection.

items.name: DragonDobok
items.description: A martial arts uniform designed for mental and physical training. You only qualify to wear this if you fulfill a particular set of prerequisites.

items.name: CommandersArmor
items.description: It's the General's armor, so it gotta be the strongest armor in town.

items.name: ButlersSuit
items.description: A graceful and courteous attitude, a soft tone, and a swallow-tailed black coat are the essentials of a butler. We can get a taste of high society by looking at them.

items.name: BattleSuit
items.description: A futuristic combat suit. It's made with bulletproof material that makes it great armor. However, when worn in hot areas, you might die of dehydration before encountering a single foe.

items.name: EODSuit
items.description: Originally developed as a bulletproof vest, often used at bomb disposal sites due to its protection.

items.name: Kabana
items.description: The armor of Karna, hero of the epic, Mahabharata. The armor becomes one with the body.

items.name: QueenOfHearts
items.description: A magical cloak that only a true queen can wear. The magic from the cloak protected the Queen, but its power hasn't been used for a while...

items.name: Watch
items.description: It's right twice a day.

items.name: Bandage
items.description: A patch that's pretty stretchy. It's good for covering injuries.

items.name: Bracelet
items.description: A metal bracelet. It feels tight. Maybe you're just nervous.

items.name: LeatherShield
items.description: Strong, but flexible. Not the best for blocking sharp attacks, but it's better than nothing.

items.name: SquadLeaderArmband
items.description: An armband normally worn by a squad commander. How did you get this?!

items.name: Bracer
items.description: Throw this on your wrist to protect you from the bow string.

items.name: Sheath
items.description: Used to keep your blade sharp. Often decorated with jewels.

items.name: GoldenBracelet
items.description: Most gold accessories are actually gold alloys. True gold is too soft. This golden bracelet would have been worth far more if it were 100% gold.

items.name: Bazuband
items.description: Older styled forearm protectors to protect your, well, forearms.

items.name: CrimsonBracelet
items.description: A bracelet lavish with white and red gemstones. However, the large size of the beads may be somewhat annoying the wearer.

items.name: SteelShield
items.description: A durable shield made of metal and leather.

items.name: SwordStopper
items.description: It is, quite literally, armor that protects from swords. The hooks on it catch and entangle blades

items.name: Draupnir
items.description: The magical golden bracelet of the Norse God, Odin. It has the power to provide unthinkable riches... and a full stomach

items.name: MithrilShield
items.description: A shield made with Mithril. It's light, but the strength is beyond imagination.

items.name: CreedOfTheKnight
items.description: Shielding is not just a skill that must be mastered by a knight, but also symbolizes a knight's creed to protect the weak.

items.name: SwordOfShahJahan
items.description: A sword used by the emperor of India's great Mughal Empire. Due to the jewels around the sword, historians doubt its use in battle.

items.name: BraceletOfSkadi
items.description: A bracelet worn by Skadi, a Norse Goddess associated with winter. Do you feel a chill?

items.name: Radar
items.description: If you can get it working properly, it might help you find the location of anyone in the world.

items.name: Slippers
items.description: A slipper soaked in sweat. The stench alone makes it a serious contender as a lethal weapon.

items.name: RunningShoes
items.description: Everyone likes running shoes. You can walk in them, too y'know.

items.name: Tights
items.description: It's thin and tight. You can wear them on your legs or over your head if you're going to rob a bank.

items.name: KneePads
items.description: Learning to ride a bike? Put these on.

items.name: ChainLeggings
items.description: Protective leg equipment. Very effective and easily made.

items.name: HighHeels
items.description: Makes you a bit taller. Maybe the air is fresher up there.

items.name: Heelys
items.description: They look like regular shoes, but you can ride them like rollerblades because of the wheels mounted in the heels. That's just the way I roll.

items.name: Boots
items.description: Protects your feet and calves. Don't wear them too tight -- it might restrict your bloodflow.

items.name: SteelKneePads
items.description: A kick to the shin is a favorite among angry girlfriends. Keep your shins protected.

items.name: FeatherBoots
items.description: They feel as light as a feather! Maybe because that's what they're made of!

items.name: KillerHeels
items.description: Heels sharp enough to be used as weapons themselves.

items.name: MaverickRunner
items.description: Heelys designed using futuristic concepts by the world renowned fashion company, Soberef. The parts are even certified by the Federal Aviation Administration. They are driven by linear motors that can get propulsion even when stopped, and there are eight compressed gas injection devices on the front allowing for limited three-dimensional operation. Also, they're LOUD.

items.name: MithrilBoots
items.description: Boots made out of mithril. Stronger than steel and fireproof, too!

items.name: EODBoots
items.description: Boots worn by explosives disposal teams. They protect the wearer's legs from shrapnel if something goes wrong.

items.name: WhiteRhinos
items.description: What kind of rhino wears boots..?

items.name: BootsOfHermes
items.description: Shoes worn by Hermes, the Greek God of Travellers. Try them on, you'll feel like you're floating.

items.name: Feather
items.description: Great for heat preservation or just for decoration!

items.name: Flower
items.description: Roses are red, violets are blue, this flower makes good items, try crafting them too.

items.name: Ribbon
items.description: It'll be pretty if you put it in your hair.

items.name: Fan
items.description: Sure, it's a bit old, but the wind from this fan isn't.

items.name: BuddhistScripture
items.description: Smells like incense. No idea what it says, though.

items.name: Box
items.description: ...It's an empty box.

items.name: HolyGrail
items.description: A relic that has materializes through various trials and adventures in Medieval myths. Many knights endured the trials, yet none ended up with a happy ending.

items.name: Cross
items.description: Feeling...holy?

items.name: Binoculars
items.description: These don't seem to zoom in much. Perhaps it's because they're homemade.

items.name: SaintsRelic
items.description: The last relic of one who fought to save those who have fallen, despite being betrayed, tortured, and crucified.

items.name: GlassPieces
items.description: Be careful not to cut yourself on the sharp edges.

items.name: Doll
items.description: Aren't you a little old to be playing with dolls?

items.name: SnipingScope
items.description: You might be able to improve your accuracy with this on a rifle or other firearm.

items.name: BuddhaSarira
items.description: A relic found in the ashes from the body of Buddha. It smells vaguely of incense.

items.name: Quiver
items.description: Rather pointless by itself. On the otherhand, if you stash some arrows in it...

items.name: FeatherDuster
items.description: Dust sticks to this thing like iron to a magnet. Feather dusters...how do they work?

items.name: GildedQuillFan
items.description: If you fan your face with this, try not to scratch yourself.

items.name: ShamansBronze
items.description: A ritual tool that is less practical but has a strong symbolic meaning.

items.name: PowderOfLife
items.description: A powder that summons the spirits. Better combined with other items to make something mystical.

items.name: Uchiwa
items.description: A fan with your favorite celebrity's face printed on it. It might block the view of the person behind you, so keep it at home during the concert.

items.name: Magazine
items.description: You can't fire a gun with nothing in the magazine.

items.name: WhiteCraneFan
items.description: Though a person may make plans in life, it is the heavens that will bring them to fruition.

items.name: MoonlightPendant
items.description: It is not just a simple pendant. Magical powers are unleashed when shining a particular light through it.

items.name: RevengeOfGoujian
items.description: King Goujian of Yue swore revenge against his rival and used this sword to see it through.

items.name: SchrodingersBox
items.description: The cat inside the box is both alive and dead at the same time. Use it to show off your knowledge of quantum physics.

items.name: VeritasLuxMea
items.description: Truth is my light.

items.name: GlacialIce
items.description: It seems different from normal ice. It practically burns me to the bone by just looking at it. Keep it out of your lemonade.

items.name: TrueSamadhiFire
items.description: Flames captured in a delicate glass sphere. Ascetics used it to escape.

items.name: Nail
items.description: Try hammering some of these into a baseball bat and take out a monster.

items.name: Leather
items.description: Are there any beasts around? Leather is versitile and can be used in tons of different ways.

items.name: TurtleShell
items.description: Reminds me of a sandbox I had as a kid.

items.name: Rubber
items.description: A material that is always elastic. Unlike your cheeks, which lose elasticity day by day.

items.name: ScrapMetal
items.description: Very old, beat up metal. Can you craft a weapon out of this?

items.name: Lighter
items.description: The ability to make fire is key.

items.name: StallionMedal
items.description: A form of identification that verifies the recognition of the royal order. There have been many cases where royalty have used this for inspection purposes.

items.name: Battery
items.description: Would be good for a flashlight, remote control, or your beeping smoke detector.

items.name: Alcohol
items.description: Whenever you smell this, either a laboratory or a hospital might come to mind.

items.name: Oil
items.description: At room temperature, this fatty component exists in liquid form.

items.name: Cloth
items.description: Made by weaving fibers. Different thread types make different fabrics.

items.name: Gemstone
items.description: An unrefined gemstone. Could be worth something in the right hands.

items.name: Glue
items.description: Why doesn't it stick to itself in the bottle?

items.name: IronOre
items.description: Just the ore. Extract the iron to make it useful!

items.name: Can
items.description: You can throw the can.

items.name: Gunpowder
items.description: Explosive powder. It goes in guns. Boom.

items.name: Stone
items.description: A stone that can be thrown or be used to make something.

items.name: GlassBottle
items.description: A glass bottle that is good for throwing.

items.name: Steel
items.description: Just some strong steel. They could name a football team after this.

items.name: Oilcloth
items.description: Oiled cloth. May be needed for something involving fire.

items.name: HeatedOil
items.description: Heated oil. It was sometimes used as a thermal weapon in the past, but now mostly used for cooking.

items.name: Ruby
items.description: Rubies and sapphires actually have the same chemical composition and mineral structure! However, rubies have a small amount of chromium that makes them appear red.

items.name: DeadBattery
items.description: Is a dead battery still a battery? Just throw it at someone!

items.name: WhitePowder
items.description: Unidentifiable white powder. Probably from chalk...

items.name: TreeOfLife
items.description: A tree that accumulated a lot of vital force over a long time. Also known as the World Tree, it symbolizes the origin of the universe and the root of life.

items.name: Meteorite
items.description: A stone containing traces of alien vital force. It has mystical effects.

items.name: Ash
items.description: The remains of something burning.

items.name: ElectronicParts
items.description: You can likely craft something out of this.

items.name: Blueprint
items.description: An elaborate blueprint. What on earth do all the lines and numbers mean?

items.name: IronSheet
items.description: This will give you goosebumps if you scrape your fingernails across it.

items.name: Gold
items.description: Soft, valuable, and gorgeous. A must have for any piece of jewelery.

items.name: Poison
items.description: DO NOT DRINK.

items.name: Motor
items.description: A motor itself is useless, but you can probably turn it into something great.

items.name: Mithril
items.description: This silver metal has the best reaction to vital force. It was strengthened due to its long exposure to VF. Light as a feather, but stronger than steel.

items.name: GlassPanel
items.description: A glass panel used for a display. If you break the one on your TV, you gotta replace it with a new panel. At that point, you might as well just get a new TV.

items.name: IonBattery
items.description: A high capacity battery made of lithium ion that can be recharged many times.

items.name: VFBloodSample
items.description: Only the strongest can get this blood sample.

items.name: ForceCore
items.description: This seems to hold untapped power.

items.name: CellPhone
items.description: I'm not getting any bars here...

items.name: Potato
items.description: Boil them, mash them, or stick them in a stew. They're also delicious eaten raw. Potatoes are magic.

items.name: Garlic
items.description: A delicious addition to many dishes. Also great for keeping away vampires.

items.name: AdhesiveBandage
items.description: Useful because it sticks to skin well and doesn't fall off easily. Just don't keep it on for too long.

items.name: Carp
items.description: A carp is actually good for throwing. I don't think the carp likes it though.

items.name: Bread
items.description: A staple food. You can also staple it to trees.

items.name: Ramen
items.description: Put it in a bag, smash it into pieces, add some spices, shake it up, and eat.

items.name: OrientalHerb
items.description: An herb used in traditional medicine.

items.name: Chocolate
items.description: When you're low on sugar, eating this makes you feel strong and happy.

items.name: CurryPowder
items.description: Would taste great if it were cooked with hot water.

items.name: GarlicBread
items.description: One of the most delicious substances known to man.

items.name: CarpBread
items.description: Carefully contemplate where to take your first bite.. the head or the tail?

items.name: HolyWater
items.description: Holy water. Good for body and spirit.

items.name: ChocoPie
items.description: Delicious frozen or in the microwave.  You can even just eat the marshmallow in between

items.name: AcupunctureNeedle
items.description: It stings.. but only just a little.

items.name: FrenchFries
items.description: This is undoubtedly the ultimate form of potato. Don't deny it.

items.name: BakedPotato
items.description: Just add butter and salt for an fantastic side dish!

items.name: BakedCarp
items.description: Fish is actually one of the most common foods to choke on.

items.name: HotRamen
items.description: With chopped onions and egg it tastes heavenly. You probably can't stop yourself from slurping it up when you eat.

items.name: MochaBread
items.description: Bread with a slight coffee flavor. Both the cream and raisin varieties are popular in Korea.

items.name: ChocolateChipCookies
items.description: A timeless classic, the chocolate chip cookie is the king of snacks.

items.name: ChocoPieBox
items.description: A box of choco pies are like a first-aid kit for your soul.

items.name: Curry
items.description: Curry is a dish made by mixing many different kinds of spices. One of the main ingredients is turmeric, which may help prevent Alzheimer's disease.

items.name: OrientalConcoction
items.description: A concoction prepared by brewing medicial herbs. Revitalizes the body.

items.name: FriedChicken
items.description: If it can fly and has wings and a beak, it's definitely a chicken. It could actually be a crow, pigeon, or whatever, but once you fry it, it will still be Fried Chicken.

items.name: HealingPotion
items.description: Also known as modern medicine.

items.name: FirstAidKit
items.description: The best bet for treating injuries. If you're in a hurt, this looks more like a treasure chest.

items.name: StirFriedRamen
items.description: Are there.. too many different ways to eat ramen?

items.name: GarlicRamen
items.description: You can't compete with expertly cooked ramen.

characters.name: Jackie
characters.background:
"More...more...more!!" - Jackie
Jackie first discovered the thrill of murder after killing the wife and daughter of the Winslair family - a prominent political family. She went on to become a serial killer with a body count of over 30 people.  
Her name 'Quilt' comes from her modus operandi of slicing the victims' bodies into small indistinguishable pieces. The resulting pieces are too small to identify, unless stitched together like a quilt.  
She gained infamy for her rather inhumane killing methods and meticulous clean-up. 
The body of Jackie's first victim, Angela Winslair, was never found.
characters.description: "Is it time for hide and seek?"

Passive.name: Bloodfest
Passive.description: When Jackie slays an enemy, attack power is enhanced for 20/25/30 seconds. Survivor, bear increase her attack power by 8/20/40%. Any other animal increases it by 3/8/15% respectively.

Q.name: Hack and Slash
Q.description: Jackie swings her weapon twice, making her target bleed. Bleeding enemies will take damage over a certain time.

W.name: Adrenaline Burst
W.description: Jackie's bursting adrenaline causes her to move faster for a moment. If she attacks a bleeding target during her adrenaline burst, she deals bonus damage to the target and restores her HP.

E.name: Leaping Strike
E.description: Jackie leaps to the targeted location, dealing damage to her enemies nearby upon landing. Hitting bleeding enemies with Leaping Strike slows their movement speed for a moment.

R.name: Chainsaw Murderer
R.description: Jackie starts her deadly chainsaw. Her chainsaw boosts her attack speed and causes targets hit by her basic attacks to bleed. She also takes a swipe at her target and deals considerable damage before she turns off her chainsaw.

characters.name: Aya
characters.background:
"For my light, for my justice." - Aya
Aya was born with an innate longing for justice, and employed this longing to become a police officer. However, her world and confidence in her job was shaken after her family were victims of a murder case. She became obsessed with her vision of justice - beginning to think that only she was able to bring justice to the world. 

Aya grew repulsed at the sight of corpses. When her job requires the occasional inspection of an animal corpse, it takes a toll on her psyche. 
She has a brother named Suzuki Hikaru, who lost both of his legs.

Passive.name: Aya's Justice
Passive.description: When Aya is attacked, she is enveloped by a protective field that blocks damage. Every time she uses her basic attack on an enemy, the cooldown of Aya's Justice is decreased by 2 seconds.

Q.name: Double Shot
Q.description: Aya rapidly shoots her target twice. The second shot does more damage.

W.name: Steady Shot
W.description: Aya shoots ten times in the targeted direction for a moment.

E.name: Moving Turn
E.description: Aya quickly dashes in the target direction.

R.name: Blank Cartridge
R.description: Aya fires a blank into the air. The sound of the gunshot startles nearby enemies, dealing damage and suppressing them for a moment.

characters.name: Fiora
characters.background:
"Waist! Neck! Your posture is a mess!" - Fiora
Fiora is a renowned fencer. Growing up, her family heavily instilled a belief that she should always have pride and a straight posture.  
Her father never recognized her talent, believing women to be only for doing chores. As an act of rebellion against her father, and with a desire to be recognized by him, Fiora took up fencing. 

She excelled at math in school. 
Fiora vows to protect anyone weaker than her, and longs for recognition by anyone stronger than her.

Passive.name: Touché
Passive.description: Fiora earns a stack of Touché every time she lands a normal attack on an enemy. When she reaches the maximum number of stacks, the Touché indicator activates for a certain time.

Q.name: Fente
Q.description: Fiora attacks in the targeted direction, dealing damage and slowing enemies hit. If the enemies have the Touché indicator, she procs the indicator. dealing extra damage and slowing enemies.

Skill damage.title: Skill damage
Skill damage.value:
60/120/180/240/300 + 0.25 AP
Touché proc: (72/144/216/288/360 + Critical Strike damage %) + 0.3AP

W.name: Attaque Composée
W.description: Fiora swings her sword two times for her next normal attack. For every Touché indicator she procs with her other skills, the cooldown for Attaque Composée is decreased by 4 seconds.

E.name: Marche & Rompre
E.description: Fiora dashes to the targeted direction, dealing damage to the enemies she hits. If the enemies have the Touché indicator, she procs the indicator, dealing extra damage. If she deals damage to an enemy, she can use the skill again within a certain time and dash backwards.

R.name: Garde
R.description: Fiora adopts an elaborate posture to unleash her most powerful attacks. When Garde is activated, every normal attack uses stamina and deals extra damage. If the stamina reaches a certain amount, the skill is automatically deactivated. It can also be deactivated by reactivating the skill.

characters.name: Magnus
characters.background:
"The Legendary Biker, Magnus!" - Magnus
Magnus is the leader of the prominent motorcycle gang found across the US, Reaper's Wheel. Even before he took the helm, the group was well-known. Other gangs and bikers tried to intimidate them wherever they went, resulting in gang fights and turf wars. 
Magnus, however, would always emerge victorious, no matter how many he was up against. He became a living legend amongst the bikers across the country and the rest of Reaper's Wheel. Magnus is proud of his absolute power. 

He has knack for aggravating and taunting others. 
His catchphrase words are "Power!" and "Persistence!"

Passive.name: Tough Body
Passive.description: Magnus's defense power increases when his HP decreases. His defense is increased for each 1% of HP lost.

Q.name: Broken Bullet
Q.description:
Magnus violently slams the ground and launches a rock towards the targeted area, dealing damage. 
Enemies hit by the rock have their movement speed reduced. The movement speed recovers slowly over time.

W.name: 17 vs 1
W.description:
Magnus swings his weapon in an area around him for 4 seconds, dealing damage. 
His movement speed is decreased by 20% while 17 vs 1 is active. 
 * He deals 1.5 times more damage to slowed or immobilized units.

E.name: Heavy Strike
E.description:
Magnus smashes the targeted enemy, dealing damage, knocking them 3.25m to the left of where Magnus is currently facing. 
If the target collides with a wall, they are stunned for 1.5 seconds.

R.name: Bike From Hell
R.description:
Magnus summons a bike, riding it for a few seconds. By reactivating the skill, Magnus will jump off of the bike and launch it forward to explode. 
If the bike hits an enemy, a wild animal, or a wall, it explodes and deals damage in an area.

characters.name: Zahir
characters.background:
"I behold the vision of the Almighty." - Zahir
After escaping from an orphanage at a young age, Zahir found himself lost and starving. He arrived at a small Sikh temple and miraculously survived. 
He became a devoted follower, believing that his God had mercifully saved him.

His morning ritual is to shower and brush his hair with a wooden comb. He sometimes speaks like an angsty teenager, but it's not easily noticed as he seldom speaks.
characters.description: "If it is God's calling, I'll gladly execute it."

Passive.name: Eye of Azrael
Passive.description: If Zahir hits an enemy with a skill, an Eye of Azrael indicator is applied to the enemy for 6 seconds and Zahir's movement speed increases. If you hit an enemy with the indicator with a skill, it deals extra damage and an Eye of Azrael effect is applied to the skill used. If you kill an enemy, you see corpses in the current area for 20 seconds.

Q.name: Narayanastra
Q.description: Zahir calls upon God's strength, dealing damage in a targeted area. Eye of Azrael effect: Narayanastra deals extra damage and the enemy's defense decreases for 2 seconds in proportion to the difference in kills between you and them.

W.name: Gandiva
W.description: Zahir throws a Chakram in the targeted direction, dealing damage. If Zahir hits an enemy with any skill but Gandiva, he gains 2 Chakrams that float behind him for 20 seconds. Eye of Azrael effect: Hitting an enemy reduces their movement speed by 30% for 1 second and reduces the cooldown of every skill, excluding Gandiva, by 1.5 seconds.

E.name: Vayvayastra
E.description: Zahir summons and launches a gust of wind, dealing damage. The first enemy hit is launched airborne for 0.5 seconds and their movement speed is reduced by 30%. Eye of Azrael effect: The enemy is launched airborne for 1 second.

R.name: Bhargavastra
R.description: Zahir calls down Chakrams from the heavens to damage enemies in a wide area, dealing damage. Bhargavastra applies an Eye of Azrael indicator to enemies if they don't have one.

characters.name: Nadine
characters.background:
"With a bow in my hands, I won't miss." - Nadine
A sudden landslide occured when Nadine was only 4 years old, resulting in the loss of both of her parents. She was the sole survivor, ultimately being rescued and raised by wild animals. Authorities declared her dead, but she was found 8 years later by a hunter, giving her a chance at a new life as a human. To this day, she struggles to live in normalcy, hesitating on even the most trivial of tasks. 

Nadine is claustrophobic due to her deep-seated memory of being buried. 
She will overthink situations to the point of freezing, but has a facade of indifference to hide it.

Passive.name: Wild and Clairvoyant
Passive.description: Nadine gets a stack of Wild for every wild animal she slays, giving some skills extra damage. Wild animals located inside a certain range near her appear on the minimap.

Q.name: Bullseye
Q.description: Nadine gathers her strength for a certain time, reducing her movement speed and gradually increasing the range of Bullseye. If she has more than a certain amount of Wild stacks, her maximum attack range increases. By reactivating the skill, she shoots an arrow, dealing damage.

W.name: Squirrel Trap
W.description: Nadine throws a Squirrel Trap at the targeted location, dealing damage to any enemies it hits and arming itself after it lands. You can throw another trap within a certain time. If the distance between the traps is less than a certain distance, they connect to each other. Enemies caught in the connected traps have their movement speed reduced, and Nadine can see them for a certain time. The connected traps disappear after a certain time.

E.name: Monkey Wire
E.description: Nadine attaches a wire at the targeted location. The installed wire stays for a certain time. While it's installed and she is attached to it, her attack speed increases. If you reactivate it, the wire returns to its anchor point, bringing Nadine with it.

R.name: Wolf Assault
R.description: For some time, Nadine summons a wolf every few normal attacks. The wolf attacks the enemy, dealing damage and reducing their attack and movement speed. (Nadine deals more damage the more Wild stacks she has.)

characters.name: Hyunwoo
characters.background:
"It couldn't get any worse." - Hyunwoo
Hyunwoo had no ambitions or dreams. All he felt was... emptiness.  
To fill the void within, he turned to the thrill of constantly picking fights and brawls.  
Despite all his attempts, the emptiness and anxiety inside him only grew. 

He has a compulsion for a lottery ticket to be the first thing he buys as an adult. 
He has always been more attached to his friends than his family.
characters.description: "This is what my fists are for!"

Passive.name: Dogfight
Passive.description: Hyunwoo receives 4 stacks of Dogfight when attacking an enemy, and 1 stack of Dogfight when being attacked. After gathering 70 stacks of HP, he heals a certain amount of his maximum health.

Q.name: Stomping Foot
Q.description: Hyunwoo stomps his foot very hard, dealing damage and slowing enemies in the targeted area for a moment.

W.name: Bluff
W.description: Hyunwoo gets bonus defense for a short time when Bluff is active. Additionally, after Bluff is activated, Hyunwoo is immune against stun, knockback, and suppression effects for a short time.

E.name: First Attack
E.description: Hyunwoo charges toward the targeted direction, dealing damage and knocking back enemies in his path. If an enemy collides with a wall, they are stunned for a moment.

R.name: Haymaker
R.description: Hyunwoo gathers his strength for a while and throws a huge punch at the targeted area, dealing considerable damage. The more time Hyunwoo spends gathering his strength, the more powerful his punch will be.

characters.name: Hart
characters.background:
"Love and ...Peace" - Hart
Hart started playing guitar, hooked on the idea that love and music can change the world. She formed a band, who in turn, gained enough popularity that they were pursued by major labels. Hart refused the offers as she would not be able to play the music she wanted. Her other band members, in need of the monetary incentives, signed a contract with a label without her. Shocked by their betrayal, and determined to prove that she was right, she became even more obsessed with using music to change people.

Her father owns an almond farm and she has a twin brother, Clever.

Passive.name: Feedback
Passive.description:
If Hart deals damage to an enemy with a normal attack, she recovers SP.  
Evolved Feedback: Hart fires an additional sound wave per evolution point. Each dealing 0.15AP damage

Q.name: Delay
Q.description:
Hart strums her guitar, charging her sound waves. When she strums the guitar again, the charged sound waves are released. She can charge for up to 4 seconds, and can maintain the sound wave for 4 seconds. She deals more damage depending on how long she charges.  
Evolved Delay: Enemies hit are slowed by -15%/-35%, based on evolution points spent on this skill.

W.name: Overdrive
W.description:
Hart plays a lick on her guitar, increasing her Attack Power for a certain time.  
Evolved Overdrive: Enemies will have their defense reduced by -15%/-30% to her next sound wave, based on evolution points spent on this skill.

E.name: Flanger
E.description:
Hart quickly dashes in the targeted direction. She can activate this skill an additional two times. She dashes and strums her guitar, discharging sound waves in a 4m area around her and dealing damage to enemies hit. Her third dash is a little bit longer.  
Evolved Flanger: Activating the skill grants 15%/25% skill damage amplificaiton for a few seconds, stacking up to 3 times.

R.name: Peacemaker
R.description:
Hart puts on a show, causing all her enemies in a range around her to dance. For every second of her performance, she recovers HP. Enemies attending the concert dance and have their movement speed reduced.  
Evolved Peacemaker: Enemies attending the concert dance have their movement speed and SP reduced. SP reduction amount increases per number of Evolution Points.

Health.title: Health
Health.value: (30 + .02 Max HP)/(40 + .03 Max HP)/(50 + .04 Max HP) per second

characters.name: Isol
characters.background:
"I can't stop here." - Isol
Isol, known as Marcelo at the time, escaped his orphanage at the age of 12 at the suggestion of his trusted friend, Francisco.   
Following his escape, he joined the terrorist group known as MOK. Isol is the sole survivor among the several child soldiers who joined the group around then.  
He tended to devolve to unnecessarily cruel ways of murder. 
Isol is overly disinterested in learning about others as he hates unnecessarily forming close relationships.

Passive.name: Guerilla Warfare
Passive.description:
Enemies that take damage from a trap of his have their defense reduced by 5/15/25%.
Photographic Memory: If an enemy sets a trap in Isol's vision range, he remembers the  trap, preventing it from going invisible for him.
Isol arms traps 0.3/0.4/0.5s faster

Q.name: Semtex Bomb
Q.description: Isol throws a bomb to the target location that sticks to an enemy or on the ground. If the bomb is thrown on the ground or sticks to an enemy, it explodes after 5 seconds, dealing 50/75/100/125/150 (+0.5 AP) damage and rooting enemies caught in the blast. If the bomb is stuck to an enemy, each attack reduces its timer by 0.5 seconds and increases the damage of the explosion by 8/12/16/20/24 (+0.3 AP).

W.name: Rebel Assault
W.description: Isol unleashes a fury of bullets in front of him, dealing damage, and reducing the movement speed of enemies by 15%.

E.name: Camouflage
E.description: Isol rolls forward and blends into his surroundings, going invisible for a bit. The invisibility is lifted if Isol does any action other than basic movement.

R.name: MOK Operational Mine
R.description:
Isol installs a MOK Operational Mine on the ground that detects enemies. The mine explodes when an enemy enters its range, dealing damage and reducing the movement speed of enemies by 10/20/30% for 2 seconds.
MOK Operational Mine is not affected by skill amplification or reduction but is affected by trap masteries.

characters.name: Li Dailin
characters.background:
"Would you please stay out of my life?" - Li Dailin
Li Dailin was the only daughter of a martial arts family. Her family chose to walk the path of mastery and training, disregarding care for her. This life resulted in nothing but resentment towards martial arts. 
To enact her revenge, she sold the martial arts studio, along with the secrets passed down for generations, abandoning her pride as a martial artist.

When she runs out of money for alcohol, she usually picks up odd jobs. 
She has a reputation as 'Beggar Li' in her hometown.
characters.description: "I'll go if there's something to drink there"

BAC.name: Blood Alcohol Content
BAC.description: Li Dailin can use Drink Up to fill her BAC bar. When her BAC is above 40, she gains Tipsy, giving her skills extra effects, and gaining Dialed In for her next normal attack. If her BAC hits 100, she becomes Inebriated, is silenced for 7 seconds and gains Dialed In.  Dialed In: Li Dailin's next normal attack will trigger twice. Her second attack deals 50/75/100% damage. Strong Stomach: her attack speed is increased 10/25/40% for a certain time after drinking alcoholic beverages.

Q.name: Spirited Kick
Q.description:
Li Dailin charges forward, dealing damage to enemies hit. She can reactivate this skill two more times. 
Tipsy: Increases range and increases damage dealt.

W.name: Drink Up
W.description: Li Dailin takes a drink for 0.8 seconds, gaining Liquid Strength and increasing her BAC by 45. While drinking, she avoids normal attacks. Normal attacks reduce the cooldown of Drink Up by 1 second.  Liquid Strength: the damage from her next normal attack and damage from Dialed In is increased depending on her BAC.

E.name: Bottom Shelf
E.description:
Li Dailin spits out cheap liquor in a cone in front of her, silencing enemies in range and dealing damage.  
Tipsy: Reduces movement speed of enemies by 20%.

R.name: Striking Tiger
R.description:
Li Dailin launches forward, suppressing the first enemy hit and following it up with two consecutive kicks. Each blow deals damage in proportion to her enemy's missing HP. 
Tipsy: follows up with 4 consecutive kicks.

characters.name: Yuki
characters.background:
"Is there anything I can do for you?" - Yuki 
A sharp high school student, Yuki is a member of the kendo club with flawless demeanor and decorum.

He never loses his composure and takes on new challenges with the confidence of a seasoned vet.
His perfectionism is sturdy, yet fragile, like a fortress of ice and glass.

Passive.name: Perfect Fit
Passive.description: Yuki stores cufflinks as a resource. Upon damaging an enemy, he consumes a stored cufflink, dealing additional true damage. Yuki recovers 1 cufflink every 4 seconds while out of combat. Activating Button Up will refill all of his cufflinks.

Q.name: From Head to Toe
Q.description:
Yuki's next normal attack deals damage and reduces the movement speed of enemies by 50% for 1 second. 
Consuming a cufflink stuns enemies for 0.5 seconds.

W.name: Button Up
W.description:
Passive: reduces cooldown of Button Up by 0.5 seconds each time Yuki takes damage. 
Yuki straightens up his outfit and reduces the cooldown for Dashing Gentleman by 6/6.5/7/7.5/8. While using Button Up, his defense is increased by 50%. When Button Up is complete, he refills his cufflinks.

E.name: Dashing Gentleman
E.description: Yuki dashes in the targeted direction, dealing damage to the first enemy hit. Enemies hit are disarmed, disabling their normal attacks.

R.name: Coup de Grace
R.description: Yuki unsheaths his sword and slashes an area in front of him, dealing damage to enemies and leaving a mark, reducing movement speed of enemies by 70% for 1 second. The mark explodes after Yuki sheathes his sword, dealing true damage based on the enemy's max HP.

Skill damage.title: Skill damage
Skill damage.value: 250/375/500(+1.5 AP) initial / 15/20/25% of enemy's max HP

characters.name: Hyejin
characters.background:
"This must be another fated way." - Hyejin 
Hyejin is the only child of a generational shaman family.
Her destiny, if she had been born after dawn, would have been straightforward and undisturbed. Hyejin was not so lucky. Having been born before dawn, she was fated to go through a great ordeal at the age of 18.
She seems to accept her destiny as it is. Being raised from a shaman family, Hyejin believes her fate has already been determined.
She often plays Bipa, a Korean lute used to communicate with spirits. To be honest though, it kinda just looks like she's murmuring to herself.

Passive.name: Three Calamities
Passive.description: When Hyejin hits an enemy with a skill, they receive a calamity. Upon reaching 3 stacks, Three Calamities is activated, fearing them. Feared enemies cannot receive Three Calamities again for 8 seconds.

Q.name: Charm of Despair
Q.description: Hyejin casts a Charm of Despair in the targeted direction, dealing damage to the first enemy hit, and reducing their movement speed for 1 second. She can recast the skill to cast another charm.

W.name: Charm of the Prophecy
W.description:
Hyejin summons a Charm of the Prophecy in the targeted location that stays at the location. Charm of Prophecy ignites after the max time, or if the skill is activated again, dealing damage to enemies in range and rooting them.
Charm of the Prophecy damage increases while on the ground.

E.name: Charm of the Nomad
E.description: Hyejin casts a Charm of the Nomad in the targeted location, dealing damage to enemies hit. Activating the skill again teleports Hyejin to the location of Charm of the Nomad, dealing damage to enemies upon landing.

R.name: Five Omens
R.description: Hyejin focuses for 1 second, summoning 5 Omens, and dealing damage to enemies in an area around her. The Omens spin around Hyejin for 20 seconds, each dealing damage to enemies hit. Omens are consumed after hitting an enemy. While focusing, her movement speed is reduced by 30%. Hyejin can teleport to her Charm of the Nomad location while focusing.

characters.name: Xiukai
characters.background:
"Stop gazing, or I will fill that dumpling with you." - Xiukai
Xiukai is a Chinese cook running his own small restaurant in Daegu, South Korea.
He used to be a cook for one of the closest associates of a high-ranking government official. His connections, and pockets, ran deep.
After his boss was disposed of overnight, he escaped to South Korea.

He claims that he was once skinny with an elegant posture... 
He is good at controlling himself, taking from his experience serving his former boss.

Passive.name: Juggernaut Chef
Passive.description:
Food and beverages made by Xiukai have 30% bonus recovery. When crafting a food item of Uncommon or higher rarity, he earns a stack of Juggernaut Chef, increasing his max HP by 8 for each stack. 
Stacks given per food: 1/2/3 for all rarities

Q.name: Lost in the Sauce
Q.description: Xiukai throws his sauce barrel in the targeted direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and reducing their movement speed by 30% for 2 seconds.

W.name: Heavy Meal
W.description:
Xiukai slams his giant wok on the ground, dealing damage in an area around him and reducing the movement speed of enemies hit by 10/20/30/40/50% for 1.5 seconds.
Enemies with impaired movement receive an additional damage (3/3.5/4/4.5/5% of Xiukai's max HP) and their movement speed is reduced for an additional 3 seconds.

E.name: Wok It Off
E.description: Xiukai slides on his wok in the targeted direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. Enemies with impared movement receive additional damage and are knocked airborne for 1 second.

Skill damage.title: Skill damage
Skill damage.value: 80/110/140/170/190(+0.5 AP) (+ 3.5% of Xiukai's max HP)  Additional Damage: (3.5% of Xiukai's max HP)

R.name: Burnt to a Crisp
R.description: Xiukai dishes out fire from his wok 6 times in 3 seconds, dealing damage to enemies in a cone in front of him. (+ stacks of Juggernaut Chef). Enemies with impaired movement have their defense reduced by 10/15/20% for 3 seconds.

characters.name: Chiara
characters.background:
"I'm ruined...There will be no salvation for me..." - Chiara 
Chiara was sent to a catholic church institution at birth. Every day, she was brainwashed with stories of the omnipotence of His Almighty.
When she was finally allowed to leave the compound, she ventured to seedy, sordid, and wretched places to preach, holding belief that God would protect her. She found herself in reprehensible situations, harshly realizing the cruel reality of life. A denial of God started growing in her mind, causing her disgust within.

She detests seeing beautiful and noble things because of her dissatisfaction with herself.

Passive.name: Stigma
Passive.description: When Chiara hits an enemy with a skill, she carves a Stigma into them, reducing their defense by 2/4/6%. Chiara can apply a maximum of 4 Stigmas to the same enemy. When the enemy reaches the maximum amount of Stigmas, Chiara's movement speed is increased for 6 seconds.

Q.name: Hand of Corruption
Q.description: Chiara casts out corrupted energy in the targeted direction, dealing damage to all enemies it hits. Hold the skill down for 0.5 seconds to cast out the corrupted energy further and in a straight line. Using the skill short-ranged reduces its cooldown by 20%.

W.name: Depraved Prayer
W.description: Chiara divines a shield, absorbing damage. The shield remains for 6 seconds. If the shield is not depleted after 3 seconds, she can reactivate the skill again, making it explode, dealing damage to enemies in range.

E.name: Mania
E.description: Chiara sends out a shackle in the targeted direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and linking them to Chiara. If the link is maintained for 1.75 seconds, she deals damage and roots the enemy for 1.5 seconds.

R.name: Last Judgement
R.description: Chiara can crash down upon an enemy with the maximum amount of Stigmas, dealing true damage and ending the Plague. Killing enemies with Last Judgement reduces the cooldown of Plague by 50%.

characters.name: Sissela
characters.background:
"Life is an agony. Only more agony awaits to greet me." - Sissela 
Suffering from an incurable disease affecting only a hundred in the world, Sissela has been hospitalized since her diagnosis at a very young age. Despite the uncountable attempts to free herself from her extreme and constant pain, she couldn’t easily end her life.

A rare specimen in medicine, she was supported with experimental treatments and fully paid medical bills. To her, it seems that she is being kept alive merely for the sake of continuing research.

She is often expressionless, and does not talk much. Often isolated, she habitually draws faces on things and gives them names to talk to them. She feels pretty awkward talking to other people.

Passive.name: Agony
Passive.description:
As Sissela's HP decreases, she gains HP regeneration and skill amplification.
HP regeneration per second: 2/4/6 ~ 26/36/46 (is not affected by the increase rate of HP regen)
Skill Amplification: 2/5/8 ~ 10/25/40 
When Wilson returns to Sissela, her next normal attack deals damage and reduces the movement speed of enemies by 10/20/30% for 2 seconds. 
Wilson may be 10.25m away from Sissela before automatically returning

Q.name: Go Get 'Em Wilson!
Q.description: Wilson flies in the targeted direction, dealing damage to enemies in his path and damage upon arrival.

W.name: Girl in a Bubble
W.description: Wilson embraces Sissela for 1.5 seconds, blocking all damage and making her invulnerable. Wilson's shield explodes after the max time, or if the skill is activated again, dealing damage to enemies in an area around her and pushing them back 2m.

E.name: Play With Us!
E.description:
Wilson stretches his body in the targeted direction, pulling the first target hit.
Ally pull: the target receives a shield, absorbing damage for 3 seconds and the cooldown of Play With Us! is reduced by 1.5 seconds.
Enemy pull: Wilson deals damage and stuns the target for 1 second.

R.name: Free at Last
R.description:
Sissela channels for 1 second. After 3 seconds, Sissela deals damage to all enemy players on the map, as well as herself.
Sissela's HP will not drop below 1 when taking damage from this skill. 
Dealing damage with this skill increases the damage from Agony by 100% for 5 seconds.

Skill damage.title: Skill damage
Skill damage.value: 150/275/400(+1.0 AP) (100% in 10m radius, 100% same area, 50% other areas) + 2 additional damage for every 1% of her missing HP

characters.name: Silvia
characters.background:
"Whoa, that looks fun!" - Silvia 
Silvia was raised by her grandfather - her parents were never really around. Her mother is a wandering photographer and there is nothing known about her father. She doesn't value making or maintaining relationships - her focus is on living in the now.
One of the biggest motives for her becoming a motorcycle racer was the thrill of the race.
Silvia excites easily and acts emotionally without thinking ahead. She gained fame among motorcycle racing circuits for riding dangerously and wrecklessly, paying no mind to the consequences.

Passive.name: Lumia Grand Prix
Passive.description: Upon entering a new area, aside from the Research Center, Silvia's attack speed is increased by 1/2/3%. If she visits all 15 areas, her skill amplification is increased by 15%. Every 30 seconds, Silvia can gain 10/12/14 fuel when visiting a new area. She regains 1 fuel every 3 seconds when not on her bike.

Q.name: Radar Gun
Q.description: Silvia fires a Radar Gun, dealing damage to enemies hit and healing herself and allies hit for 40/60/80/100/120(+AP 30%) HP. Silvia gains 5 fuel for each target she hits, excluding herself.

W.name: Finish Line
W.description: Silvia sets up a Finish Line in the targeted location, dealing damage and decreasing the movement speed of enemies that pass through it for 3 seconds. This only occurs the first time an enemy passes through.

E.name: Spare Tire
E.description: Silvia launches a Spare Tire in the targeted direction, dealing damage based on the distance. Enemies within 3m are knocked back. Upon hitting an enemy further than 3m, Silvia gains 2~24 fuel based on the distance the tire traveled.

R.name: Shift Gears
R.description:
Silvia hops on her motorcycle, consuming 5 fuel every 1 second, increasing her movement speed, and giving her different skills. She can use Shift Gears when her fuel is above 30. Silvia cannot use normal attacks or weapon skills while riding her motorcycle. 
When she first changes to motorcycle mode she decreases her movement speed by 50% while reving up for 1.5s.
Her defense increases by 10/17/24 while on the bike.
Moving the bike within a range of 10 degrees left or right increases her speed gradually until a maximum of +70%. Turning the bike range more than 10 degrees in either direction decreases her speed proportionally to the turn angle, down until 80% of your base movement speed.

on bike Q.name: Power Slide
on bike Q.description: Silvia spins on her bike, dealing damage to enemies in range.

on bike W.name: Front Flip
on bike W.description: Silvia jumps in the direction she is currently facing, dealing damage to enemies in range and knocking them airborne.

on bike E.name: Wheelie
on bike E.description: Silvia wheelies toward the targeted enemy dealing damage and knocking them 1m back. She deals additional damage depending on her movement speed.

on bike R.name: Shift Gears
on bike R.description: Silvia dismounts her bike and reverts her skills. Her next normal attack within 3 seconds deals damage.

characters.name: Adriana
characters.background:
"It's kinda chilly... Where'd I put that match?" - Adriana
